title: Domingo Tejera
text:
Domingo Tejera (July 22, 1899 in <a href="Montevideo">Montevideo</a>- June 30, 1969) was a <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> player from <a href="Uruguay">Uruguay</a>. He was part of the <a href="Uruguay%20national%20football%20team">Uruguay</a> team that won the gold medal at the <a href="1928%20Summer%20Olympics">1928 Summer Olympics</a>, and the <a href="1930%20FIFA%20World%20Cup">1930 FIFA World Cup</a> held in Uruguay.
Tejera played club football for <a href="Montevideo%20Wanderers">Montevideo Wanderers</a>. He made over 200 appearances and won the Uruguayan league twice with Montevideo Wanderers. Tejera made 17 appearances for the <a href="Uruguay%20national%20football%20team">national team</a> from 1922 to 1932. He won the <a href="1920%20South%20American%20Championship">1920 South American Championship</a> prior to making his international debut, a tournament in which he was part of the squad but did not featured in any matches.
